wikipedia_page.main: John Horsburgh (1791 – 24 September 1869) was a Scottish engraver.

response: The son of Grizell and Robert Scott, he was born on 13 November 1777 at Lanark, where his father was a skinner. He attended the grammar school at Musselburgh, and at the age of ten was articled to Andrew Robertson, an engraver at Edinburgh; there he also worked in the Trustees' Academy. Among his pupils were John Burnet, John Horsburgh, and James Stewart. He died early in 1841 in Edinburgh.
His portrait by John Horsburgh is held by the City of Edinburgh Council at Leith Town Hall (now Leith Police station) along with a marble bust of him.
